title: Brexit referendum Remainers were right says Jean-Claude Juncker
text:
Jean-Claude Juncker has declared that the 48 percent of British voters who chose Remain in the Brexit referendum “were right,'' as Donald Tusk said the “door would always be open” for the UK to rejoin the EU.

“In my heart I will always be a Remainer and I hope our British friends will decide to return one day,” Mr Tusk, the president of the European Council, said after EU leaders backed the Brexit deal at a summit in Brussels.

"I would like to say to the 48 percent that they were right,” Mr Juncker, the president of the European Commission said at a Brussels.

“I am happy and relieved that we reached a deal but I am sad because Brexit is happening,” he said.
